Children.Text: The inert pool captures organic matter that either does not decompose, or decomposes at a rate slow enough to be of little importance to simulations.  Such an approach was also captured in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial C (kg/ha) is calculated as an assumed inert fraction of the measured bulk soil organic C, bulk density and layer thickness.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial N (kg/ha) is calculated with the assumption that the inert pool has the same C:N ratio as the bulk soil.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial N (kg/ha) is calculated with the assumption that the inert pool has the same C:N ratio as the bulk soil.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: This pool is used to provide the information about potential flows of Carbon and nutrients from the surface organic matter model to the soil nutrient model.  The potential daily flows of C and nutrients is provided to this pool at run time. Matter not decomposed is returned to the surface organic matter model.  Such an approach was also captured in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]). This implementation is currently used to reproduce original functionality and should be refactored at some time in the future.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The soil nutrient model will attempt to decompose all potentially decomposable surface organic materials.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: This pool simulates the urea content of each soil layer.  Much of the capability has been taken from implementation in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]), which was derived from approaches in CERES-Maize ([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The nitrogen flow captures the conversion of urea to ammonium by urease enzymes from soil bacteria.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: This pool simulates the nitrate content of each soil layer.  Much of the capability has been taken from implementation in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]), which was derived from approaches in CERES-Maize ([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Denitrification is simulated using the approaches initially used in CERES Maize ([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]) as implemented in APSIM SoilN ([probert_apsims_1998]).  These were based upon the work of [Rolston1984].  Denitrification rate is calculated using this approach to account for the effect of soil carbon, temperature and water on the fraction of nitrate lost on a daily basis.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The emission of N2O during denitrification is calculated from an N2:N2O ratio using the approach from the DayCent model ([PARTON1998]) as previously tested in APSIM ([THORBURN2010]).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The FOMLignin pool captures "lignin-like" material within fresh organic matter (FOM).  Such as approach was also captured in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]) and in CERES Maize([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]). This pool has the slowest decomposition rate of the three FOM pools.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: This C in this pool is initialised as a set fraction of the initial root residue mass at initialisation.  This mass is assumed to be 40% Carbon.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: It is assumed that the C:N ratio of this pool is the same as the C:N of the total root residue material.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The FOMCellulose pool captures "cellulose-like" material within fresh organic matter (FOM).  Such as approach was also captured in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]) and in CERES Maize([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: This C in this pool is initialised as a set fraction of the initial root residue mass at initialisation.  This mass is assumed to be 40% Carbon.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: It is assumed that the C:N ratio of this pool is the same as the C:N of the total root residue material.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The FOMCarbohydrate pool captures "carbohydrate-like" material within fresh organic matter (FOM).  Such as approach was also captured in the APSIM SoilN model ([probert_apsims_1998]) and in CERES Maize([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]). This pool has the fastest decomposition rate of the three FOM pools.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: This C in this pool is initialised as a set fraction of the initial root residue mass at initialisation.  This mass is assumed to be 40% Carbon.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: It is assumed that the C:N ratio of this pool is the same as the C:N of the total root residue material.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The microbial pool (formally Biom pool in APSIM SoilNitrogen) represents the more labile, soil microbial biomass and microbial products.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial C (kg/ha) is calculated from an assumed biomass fraction of the non-inert soil organic C, bulk density and layer thickness.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial N (kg/ha) is calculated with the assumption that microbial biomass maintains a constant C:N ratio.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial N (kg/ha) is calculated with the assumption that the inert pool has the same C:N ratio as the bulk soil.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Decomposition of this pool is calculated as a first-order process with rate constants modified by factors such as soil temperature and moisture. There is also an internal cycling of carbon and nitrogen (ie microbes feeding on microbial products).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The default potential decomposition rate comes from SoilN ([probert_apsims_1998]). For sandy soils, the rate is modified as per [Asseng1998163].
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: The humic pool represents the largest soil organic matter pool consisting of organic matter with much lower decomposition rate.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial C (kg/ha) is calculated as that component of the total soil carbon that has not been already attributed to the other soil carbon pools.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial N (kg/ha) is calculated with the assumption that the inert pool has the same C:N ratio as the bulk soil.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Initial N (kg/ha) is calculated with the assumption that the inert pool has the same C:N ratio as the bulk soil.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Decomposition of this pool is calculated as a first-order process with rate constants modified by factors such as soil temperature and moisture.
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Denitrification is simulated using the approaches initially used in CERES Maize ([jones_ceres-maize:_1986]) as implemented in APSIM SoilN ([probert_apsims_1998]).
Children.Name: Memo

Children.Text: Currently, no N2O is assumed to be produced during nitrification processes.
Children.Name: Memo
